intro: Pistolochia solida, commonly known as the hardy dodder, is a parasitic plant that lacks chlorophyll and relies on host plants for nutrients. It belongs to the family Santalaceae and is native to parts of Africa and Asia. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and has a unique, thread-like appearance due to its reduced leaves. It is often found growing on the stems of other plants, such as grasses and shrubs. Despite its parasitic nature, it plays a role in ecological systems by influencing host plant growth and diversity.
